solution_line_template: She reduced the price of the ${cupcake_original_price} cupcakes by half so they are now {cupcake_original_price}/{half_reduction_divisor} = $<<{cupcake_original_price}/{half_reduction_divisor}={cupcake_reduced_price}>>{cupcake_reduced_price}

She reduced the price of the ${cookie_original_price} cookies by half so they are now {cookie_original_price}/{half_reduction_divisor}= $<<{cookie_original_price}/{half_reduction_divisor}={cookie_reduced_price}>>{cookie_reduced_price}

She sold {num_cupcakes_sold} cupcakes at ${cupcake_reduced_price} each so she made = {num_cupcakes_sold}*{cupcake_reduced_price} = $<<{num_cupcakes_sold}*{cupcake_reduced_price}={money_from_cupcakes}>>{money_from_cupcakes}

She sold {num_cookies_sold} cookies at ${cookie_reduced_price} each so she made {num_cookies_sold}*{cookie_reduced_price} = $<<{num_cookies_sold}*{cookie_reduced_price}={money_from_cookies}>>{money_from_cookies}

She made ${money_from_cupcakes} from the cupcakes and ${money_from_cookies} from the cookies for a total of {money_from_cupcakes}+{money_from_cookies} = $<<{money_from_cupcakes}+{money_from_cookies}={total_money_made}>>{total_money_made}
